intro: Phyllanthus mantadiensis, commonly known as the mantanani phyllanthus, is a flowering plant native to the island of Mantanani in the Sulu Sea, Indonesia. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and smooth, waxy leaves. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to saline and brackish water environments. Its ecological significance lies in its role as a unique species contributing to the biodiversity of its restricted habitat. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered a vulnerable species.
